text.tspan: HoneyBadger allows a network of N nodes with at most F faulty ones, where 3 f < N, to input contributions and agree on a sequence of batches of
contributions. The protocol proceeds in epochs, one batch is output in each epoch. It never terminates: It handles a continuous stream of incoming contributions
and keeps producing new batches from them. All correct nodes will output the same batch for each epoch. Each validator proposes one contribution per epoch,
and every batch contains the contributions of at least N - F validators.
encoding and a Merkle tree to
can tolerate up to F faulty peers
BinaryAgreement collectively decides whether to include a
proposer's message content or not. If N - F nodes agree, then the
decision is made. If consensus is not reached, flip a common coin
to decide, using the common coin's value as the proposed decision
Subset arranges and aggregates all protocol messages necessary to create a validated content block
